result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa M. Klitzka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in FTE/schooling or combination of the two.
Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol with random UA's to ensure compliance of sobriety.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Complete any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  Complete AODA and follow through.  DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other sentences currently serving

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety from controlled substances and alcohol.

Complete AODA with follow through. 

Any outstanding costs are to be paid as condition of ES.

records.addlTxt: State and Atty Bliss in agreement of DOC Letter - Judge to approve
From DOC requesting credit adjustment, APPROVED and signed 9-24-18
to Court from DOC 8/15/18 re: credit

Clerk: Kimberly
Case called: 1:18pm
INCLUDES 15CF198, 15CF268, 16CF520, 16CM1933
State appears by ADA Davis Runde; Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty John Bliss. 

Parties state joint recommendation for sentencing.
COURT does not abide by joint recommendation on sentencing. 
COURT ORDERS: 15CF198 Ct. 1 Possession of Methamphetamine- repeater: 3 years WSPS- 1 year IC, 2 years ES. Ct. 2 Neglecting a child- repeater: 2 years WSPS- 1 year IC, 1 year ES. 309 days jail credit granted on each count.  
COURT ORDERS: 15CF268 Ct. 2 Resisting or Obstructing an Officer- repeater: 2 years WSPS- 1 year IC, 1 year ES. 309 days jail credit granted. 
COURT ORDERS: 16CF520 Ct. 1 Bail Jumping- Felony- repeater: 5 and half years WSPS- 2 and half years IC, 3 years ES. Ct. 4 Retail Theft- Intentionally take (<=$500)- repeater: 2 years WSPS- 1 year IC, 1 year ES. 309 days jail credit granted on each count. 
COURT ORDERS: 16CM1933 Ct. 2 Retail Theft- Intentionally take (<=$500): Serve 9 months MCJ. 148 days jail credit granted. 
COURT ORDERS: All sentences to run concurrent to each other and concurrent to any other sentences currently serving. CONDITONS OF ES: Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Maintain absolute sobriety from controlled substances and alcohol. Any outstanding costs are be paid as conditions of ES. Deft is eligible for both prison programming- Substance Abuse & Challenge Incarcertion. 
Adj: 1:36pm

COURT grants above
PLEA: 
15CF198:
Ct. 1 Possession of Methamphetamine- repeater >> NO CONTEST
Ct. 2 Neglecting a child- repeater >> NO CONTEST
15CF268:
Ct. 2 Resisting or Obstructing an Officer- repeater >> NO CONTEST
15CF356:
Ct. 4 Possession of THC- habitual criminality- "repeater" >> NO CONTEST
16CF520:
Ct. 1 Bail Jumping- Felony- repeater >> NO CONTEST
Ct. 4 Retail Theft- Intentionally Take (<=$500)- repeater >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 3 years probation on each felony. 2 years probation on each misdemeanors. Terms of probation are concurrent to each other. CONDITIONS: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, with random UA's to ensure compliance of sobriety. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. 16CF520- 30 days credit granted if revoked. 15CF198 & 15CF268- 137 days credit granted if revoked. $250.00 cash posted in 15CF356 returned to poster. 

Adj: 10:15am
Plea hearing on July 20, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Final pre-trial on August 1, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Jury Trial on August 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

COURT will set all matters for jury trial ASAP

Case Called: 9:06am. Clerk: Denise.  INCLUDES 15CF198, 15CF268, 15CF356. State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer for ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Andrew Morgan. Matter set on Defense's Mtn to Modify Bond. State recites history of the matter - regarding statements made at prelim by BR 5 Judge Moran re: bond but is (BR 1 case); Atty Steve Robinson appears as he is on other matters. Atty Morgan moves for release for assessment to be accomplished at HCC.  Atty Robinson makes statement. Further statements by State & Defendant. COURT makes findings. COURT denies bond modification at this time. Counsel to look into possible Stipulation re: jail's accommodation. DATES: Calendar Call 6/8/15 @ 1pm. Adjourned: 9:14am.
